SENT.plain: Seven children with a primary myelodysplastic syndrome were seen at our center over a 9-year period
Two presented with refractory anemia, three with refractory anemia with excess of blasts, and two with refractory anemia with excess of blasts in transformation
All children received supportive therapy, including blood transfusions in five of them
Three patients developed acute myeloid leukemia and were treated with intensive chemotherapy, followed by allogeneic or autologous marrow transplantation in the two responders
All three died of either infection or progressive disease
The other four patients are still alive a median of 71 months (range 38-130) after diagnosis
These results confirm the difficulties in managing patients with myelodysplastic syndromes
